proposal.name: WEBGL_multi_draw_instanced

contributors.contributor: Members of the WebGL working group

mirrors.name: ANGLE_multi_draw
mirrors.addendum: This extension only exposes the MultiDrawArraysInstancedANGLE and MultiDrawElementsInstancedANGLE entrypoints as multiDrawArraysInstancedWEBGL and multiDrawElementsInstancedWEBGL.

The implementation must validate the arrays and indices referenced by multiDrawArraysInstancedWEBGL, multiDrawElementsInstancedWEBGL, similarly to how indices referenced by drawArrays and drawElements are validated according to section Enabled Vertex Attributes and Range Checking of the WebGL specification.

Although the extension name is named WEBGL_multi_draw_instanced, the extension must be enabled with the #extension GL_ANGLE_multi_draw directive, as shown in the sample code, to use the extension in a shader.
Likewise the shading language preprocessor #define GL_ANGLE_multi_draw, will be defined to 1 if the extension is supported.

The new draw call entrypoints have typed array or sequence arguments instead of pointer arguments. They additionally include *Offset arguments for each array to choose the starting point into the respective typed array or sequence. This primarily avoids allocation of temporary typed array views.

div.p: CAD vendors rendering large models comprised of many individual parts face scalability issues issuing large numbers of draw calls from WebGL. This extension reduces draw call overhead by allowing better batching.

features.feature: The multiDrawArraysInstancedWEBGL and multiDrawElementsInstancedWEBGL entry points are added. These provide a counterpoint to instanced rendering and are more flexible for certain scenarios. They behave identically to multiple calls to drawArraysInstanced and drawElementsInstanced except they handle multiple lists of arguments in one call.

The gl_DrawID builtin is added to the shading language. For any Multi* instanced draw call variant, the index of the draw i may be read by the vertex shader as gl_DrawID. For non Multi* calls, the value of gl_DrawID is 0.

proposal.security: The multi-draw APIs are subject to all of the same rules regarding out-of-range array accesses as the core WebGL APIs.
